h701.definition: patrial from {{h694}}; an Arbite or native of Arab; Arbite.

h704.definition: the same as {{h702}}; Arba, one of the Anakim; Arba.

h707.definition: a primitive root; to plait or weave; weaver(-r).

h708.definition: from {{h707}}; a weaving; a braid; also a shuttle; beam, weaver's shuttle.

h709.definition: from the same as {{h7263}}; stony; Argob, a district of Palestine; Argob.

h712.definition: perhaps from {{h7264}} (in the sense of being suspended),; a box (as a pannier); coffer.

h713.definition: of foreign origin; purple (the color or the dyed stuff); purple.

h714.definition: from an unused root probably meaning to wander; fugitive; Ard, the name of two Israelites; Ard.

h715.definition: from the same as {{h714}}; roaming; Ardon, an Israelite; Ardon.

h716.definition: patronymic from {{h714}}; an Ardite (collectively) or descendant of Ard; Ardites.

h717.definition: a primitive root; to pluck; gather, pluck.

h718.definition: (Aramaic) probably akin to {{h431}}; lo!; behold, lo.

h719.definition: probably from {{h7300}}; a refuge for the roving; Arvad, an island-city of Palestine; Arvad.

h720.definition: an orthographical variation of {{h719}}; fugitive; Arod, an Israelite; Arod.

h721.definition: patrial from {{h719}}; an Arvadite or citizen of Arvad; Arvadite.

h722.definition: patronymic from {{h721}}; an Arodite or descendant of Arod; Arodi, Arodites.

h723.definition: or אֲרָיָה; from {{h717}} (in the sense of feeding); a herding-place for an animal; stall.

h724.definition: or אֲרֻכָה; feminine passive participle of {{h748}} (in the sense of restoring to soundness); wholeness (literally or figuratively); health, made up, perfected.

h725.definition: a variation of {{h7316}}; height; Arumah, a place in Palestine; Arumah.

h726.definition: a clerical error for {{h130}}; an Edomite (as in the margin); Syrian.

h727.definition: or אָרֹן; from {{h717}} (in the sense of gathering); a box; ark, chest, coffin.

h728.definition: or (by transposition) אוֹרְנָה; or אַרְנִיָּהlemma אַנִיָּה missing resh, corrected to אַרְנִיָּה; all by orthographical variation for {{h771}}; Aravnah (or Arnijah or Ornah), a Jebusite; Araunah.

h729.definition: a primitive root; to be firm; used only in the passive participle as a denominative from {{h730}}; of cedar; made of cedar.

h730.definition: from {{h729}}; a cedar tree (from the tenacity of its roots); cedar (tree).

h731.definition: feminine of {{h730}}; cedar wainscoating; cedar work.

h732.definition: a primitive root; to travel; go, wayfaring (man).

h733.definition: from {{h732}}; way faring; Arach, the name of three Israelites; Arah.

h734.definition: from {{h732}}; a well-trodden road (literally or figuratively); also a caravan; manner, path, race, rank, traveller, troop, (by-, high-) way.

h736.definition: feminine active participle of {{h732}}; a caravan; (travelling) company.

h737.definition: feminine passive participle of {{h732}} (in the sense of appointing); a ration of food; allowance, diet, dinner, victuals.

h738.definition: or (prolonged) אַרְיֵה; from {{h717}} (in the sense of violence); a lion; (young) lion,   pierce (from the margin).

h739.definition: or אֲרִאֵל; from {{h738}} and {{h410}}; lion of God; i.e. heroic; lionlike men.

h740.definition: the same as {{h739}}; Ariel, a symbolical name for Jerusalem, also the name of an Israelite; Ariel.

h741.definition: either by transposition for {{h739}} or, more probably, an orthographical variation for {{h2025}}; the altar of the temple; altar.

h742.definition: of Persian origin; Aridai, a son of Haman; Aridai.

h743.definition: of Persian origin; Aridatha, a son of Haman; Aridatha.

h745.definition: the same as {{h738}}; lion; Arjeh, an Israelite; Arieh.

h746.definition: of foreign origin; Arjok, the name of two Babylonians; Arioch.

h747.definition: of Persian origin; Arisai, a son of Haman; Arisai.

h748.definition: a primitive root; to be (causative, make) long (literally or figuratively); defer, draw out, lengthen, (be, become, make, pro-) long,   (out-, over-) live, tarry (long).

h749.definition: (Aramaic) properly, corresponding to {{h748}}, but used only in the sense of reaching to a given point; to suit; be meet.

h750.definition: from {{h748}}; long; long(-suffering, -winged), patient, slow (to anger).

h751.definition: from {{h748}}; length; Erek, a place in Babylon; Erech.

h754.definition: (Aramaic) or אַרְכָּה; (Aramaic), from {{h749}}; length; lengthening, prolonged.

h755.definition: (Aramaic) from an unused root corresponding to {{h7392}} (in the sense of bending the knee); the knee; knee.

h756.definition: (Aramaic) patrial from {{h751}}; an Arkevite (collectively) or native of Erek; Archevite.

h757.definition: patrial from another place (in Palestine) of similar name with {{h751}}; an Arkite or native of Erek; Archi, Archite.

h758.definition: from the same as {{h759}}; the highland; Aram or Syria, and its inhabitants; also the name of the son of Shem, a grandson of Nahor, and of an Israelite; Aram, Mesopotamia, Syria, Syrians.

h759.definition: from an unused root (meaning to be elevated); a citadel (from its height); castle, palace. Compare {{h2038}}.

h760.definition: from {{h758}} and {{h6678}}; Aram of Tsoba (or Coele-Syria); Aram-zobah.

h761.definition: patrial from {{h758}}; an Aramite or Aramaean; Syrian, Aramitess.

h762.definition: feminine of {{h761}}; (only adverbial) in Aramæan; in the Syrian language (tongue), in Syriac.

h763.definition: from {{h758}} and the dual of {{h5104}}; Aram of (the) two rivers (Euphrates and Tigris) or Mesopotamia; Aram-naharaim, Mesopotamia.

h764.definition: from {{h759}}; palatial; Armoni, an Israelite; Armoni.

h765.definition: from {{h7442}}; stridulous; Aran, an Edomite; Aran.

h766.definition: from the same as {{h765}} (in the sense of strength); the ash tree (from its toughness); ash.

h767.definition: the same as {{h766}}; Oren, an Israelite; Oren.

h768.definition: of uncertain derivation; the hare; hare.

h769.definition: or אַרְנֹןlemma אַרְנן missing vowel, corrected to אַרְנֹן; from {{h7442}}; a brawling stream; the Arnon, a river east of the Jordan, also its territory; Arnon.

h770.definition: probably from the same as {{h769}}; noisy; Arnan, an Israelite; Arnan.

h771.definition: probably from {{h766}}; strong; Ornan, a Jebusite; Ornan. See {{h728}}.

h772.definition: (Aramaic) corresponding to {{h776}}; the earth; by implication (figuratively) low; earth, interior.

h774.definition: from {{h7502}}; spread out; Arpad, a place in Syria; Arpad, Arphad.

h775.definition: probably of foreign origin; Arpakshad, a son of Noah; also the region settled by him; Arphaxad.

h776.definition: from an unused root probably meaning to be firm; the earth (at large, or partitively a land); × common, country, earth, field, ground, land, × natins, way, + wilderness, world.

h777.definition: from {{h776}}; earthiness; Artsa, an Israelite; Arza.

h778.definition: (Aramaic) by transmutation for {{h772}}; the earth; earth.

h779.definition: a primitive root; to execrate; × bitterly curse.

h780.definition: of foreign origin; Ararat (or rather Armenia); Ararat, Armenia.

h781.definition: a primitive root; to engage for matrimony; betroth, espouse.

h782.definition: from {{h781}} (in the sense of desiring to possess); a longing for; request.

h783.definition: or אַרְתַּחְשַׁשְׁתְּא; or by permutation אַרְתַּחְשַׁסְתְּא; of foreign origin; Artachshasta (or Artaxerxes), a title (rather than name) of several Persian kings; Artaxerxes.

h784.definition: a primitive word; fire (literally or figuratively); burning, fiery, fire, flaming, hot.

h786.definition: identical (in origin and formation) with {{h784}}; entity, used only adverbially, there is or are; are there, none can. Compare {{h3426}}.

h787.definition: (Aramaic) corresponding (by transposition and abbreviation) to {{h803}}; a foundation; foundation.

h788.definition: probably from the same as {{h7640}}; flowing; Ashbel, an Israelite; Ashbel.

h789.definition: patronymic from {{h788}}; an Ashbelite (collectively) or descendant of Ashbel; Ashbelites.

h790.definition: probably from the same as {{h7644}}; vigorous; Eshban, an Idumaean; Eshban.

h791.definition: from {{h7650}}; adjurer; Asbea, an Israelite; Ashbea.

h792.definition: from {{h376}} and {{h1168}}; man of Baal; Eshbaal (or Ishbosheth), a son of Saul; Eshbaal.

h793.definition: from an unused root meaning to pour; an outpouring; stream.

h795.definition: from {{h7703}}; ravager; Ashdod, a place in Palestine; Ahdod.

h796.definition: patrial from {{h795}}; an Ashdodite (often collectively) or inhabitant of Asdod; Ashdodites, of Ashdod.

h797.definition: feminine of {{h796}}; (only adverb) in the language of Ashdod; in the speech of Ashdod.

h798.definition: from the plural of {{h794}} and {{h6449}} with the article interposed; ravines of the Pisgah; Ashdoth-Pisgah, a place east of the Jordan; Ashdoth-pisgah.

h799.definition: from {{h784}} and {{h1881}}; a fire-law; fiery law.
